Description: Reconstructed fragments of upper part of black-figure painted pottery situla, with three-reeded handle. A and B, encircled buds linked by palmette - on A an extra bud at the right: below, lotus flowers and palmettes. Purple in rings round buds and in bars joining them, as well as in the usual places.
Curator's comments: The fragments do not all join, but are evidently from the same pot. The decoration of the top part is, as Kinch observed, like that of the 'Vroulian' amphora Karlsruhe B.2311 (Kinch, op. cit., fig. 69, and see pp. 187-90; Zervos, op. cit., fig. 303; CVA ii, pl. 345. 5). Three-reeded handles occur in Group B (no. 1), but the other handles of Group C are four-reeded. The abnormal upper panels, the long handles, and the number of reeds suggest that this situla belongs to the beginning of Group C. Kinch, op. cit., fig. 71. Zervos, op. cit., fig. 305.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 603, 3-4) (Group C29)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 16)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 269)
